text: Hotel Suite of the Week: Chicago's Renaissance Downtown's Riviere Suite + âˆ’ Fresh off a $27 million lobby and guestroom renovation, the Renaissance Chicago Downtown, located at 1 W. Wacker, has made a point to highlight its Windy City locale. Pictured here is the front desk: As one the most significant symbols to natives of the city, the Ys in the front desk show the local pride. Renaissance Chicago Downtown Fresh off a $27 million lobby and guestroom renovation, the Renaissance Chicago Downtown, located at 1 W. Wacker, has made a point to highlight its Windy City locale. Pictured here is the front desk: As one the most significant symbols to natives of the city, the Ys in the front desk show the local pride. Renaissance Chicago Downtown The hotel aims to be as diverse as the city of Chicago itself. That's why it chose graffiti on the ceiling above the bar and ballerinas andL-trains lining the columns. Renaissance Chicago Downtown With a blown up map of the surrounding area of the Renaissance Chicago Downtown, the library is a favorite hangout for hotel guests. Renaissance Chicago Downtown "Staytion," as the lobby bar (pictured) is called, gives guests a peek into Chicago's transportation system. It features dimly lit hanging lights surrounding the bar, and windows inspired by CTA busses circa 1900s looking into the chef's display kitchen. Renaissance Chicago Downtown The Renaissance Chicago Downtown's Riviere Suite is not only a comfortable place to spend the night, but also features a place to lounge or have a team meeting over hors d'oeuvres or dessert. Renaissance Chicago Downtown The master bathroom (pictured) has a double sink vanity and large lighted make-up mirror plus sterling silver finishes and white subway tiles that line the wall from floor to ceiling. Renaissance Chicago Downtown The Riviere Suite's bedroom has a modern, open space feel, with a pillow top mattress king bed, chaise lounge chair and city views. Renaissance Chicago Downtown Another shot of the suite bedroom. Renaissance Chicago Downtown The 1,000-square-foot Riviere Suite has seating for six at the living room table, Chicago city views and custom art not only in the suite, but in all 560 guest rooms.
